summary: The document is a journal entry from the Office of Legislative Counsel dated 1 February 1977, detailing various administrative and liaison activities. It includes discussions on budget matters, intelligence-related costs, and the submission of a foreign service list to the Senate. Additionally, it mentions the House Select Committee on Assassinations and issues regarding access to unclassified material and security clearances.
key_findings: Discussion on the FY78 budget and intelligence-related costs with Senate Appropriations Committee staff.
Mention of potential new members joining the Intelligence Subcommittee of the Senate Appropriations Committee.
Submission of the number of Agency employees covered by the upcoming foreign service list to the Senate Foreign Relations Committee.
Update on the House Select Committee on Assassinations, including restrictions on access to unclassified material and the process for security clearances.
